intro: Crotalaria agatiflora subsp. erlangeri, commonly known as the Erlanger's crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod-bearing fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces vibrant yellow flowers with a distinctive spurred structure. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
